sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; export default function Questions() { return (

Frequently Asked Questions

Why is knowing my genetic profile necessary?

Genetic sequencing will allow us to design a program specifically for you. Every single human has a different genetic sequence and predisposition for disease. By knowing what you are likely to develop and will be able to intervene before the disease develops.

Why is frequent and comprehensive laboratory monitoring necessary?

By evaluation of our cardiovascular risks, lipid profile, renal function, hormone status and vitamin and mineral levels through blood testing, we can make the MOST informed medical recommendations.

Why are lifestyle factors so important?

If we do not understand your life, how can we make recommendations that will help you? The more we know about how your life, the better we will be able to help.

What are the steps in the process?

1. Initial consultation
2. Genetic and laboratory analysis
3. Plan development
4. Monthly health coaching with FNP
5. Text access to providers with 48 hr response time
6. Bi-monthly meetings with MD

); }
